page.title: 04Farming around Moortown
page.content: This block is full of rich agricultural land. The soils are formed from boulder clay which covers New Red Sandstone rock. The moderate rainfall and sunny summers encourage good grass growth, suitable for {pastoral farming (dairying). } The land is generally flat or gently rolling. The drainage of the soil does vary within the area, and this has played a major role in determining land use. The moister areas are used for improved pasture and the drier areas for cereal production, chiefly for animal feed. The chief crop is {barley,}some of which is sent to breweries in the West Midland conurbation, eg at Wolverhampton. The chief type of stock is Fresian dairy cattle. Farms are large and well eqipped.
